snippet: President François Hollande said the deliveries were in response to “urgent” appeals from the Kurds. Britain also announced nonlethal aid deliveries.
abstract: European nations move to intensify their involvement in Iraq, announcing further humanitarian aid and, for the first time, pledging to supply arms to embattled Kurdish forces fighting Sunni militants who have overrun much of northern Iraq; even France announces that it will send arms to help.

byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Suzanne Daley reported from Paris, and Alan Cowell from London. Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: President François Hollande said the deliveries were in response to “urgent” appeals from the Kurds. Britain also announced nonlethal aid deliveries.

headline.main: France Plans to Ship Arms to Embattled Kurdish Forces in Iraq
headline.print_headline: France Plans to Ship Arms to Embattled Kurdish Forces in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
